content.description:
From David Donally:

Located in the gully east of the water tower. What is a gully? Bouler the direct start, rest, then let your patience guide you through the fury that lies ahead. Stay calm, the jugs are there for you in the end.
content.protection: 5 bolts to lower-off stainless carabiners. Also, TR but can be done if you are careful to lean over the edge. The bolts are a little farther down than usual. Watch for slippery pine needles.

climbs.name: What's Cat Got to do With It?

content.description: Jugs to a rest stance that leaves you 2 ways to skin the cat.
content.location: This route is located at Tiny Dishman. Just walk up the gully another 100 feet or so after Little Dishman. This is the second route on the left.

content.description: Right of Tiny Dishman. If anyone knows the name, we would love to correct it.
content.location: Go to the wall with three 5.9 routes. Go a couple meters to the right of the 5.9 wall. The route will have some moss on it, recommended to top rope and not trad climb.

content.description: Sit start in the little bowl, bump up to the crack line, then keep going straight up till you reach the sloper. Eventually will have a top out when it gets all cleaned.
content.location: Walk towards the main Lead/Top rope wall, you see the boulder on your left at about the half way point. Cant miss it at this point now that its all chalked up and cleaned.

content.description: Fun little warm up, crux area would be around the last two holds for newer climbers. Solid warm up line for the other routes nearby. Pretty solid top out, maybe needs a little more cleaning, but it'll climb.
content.location: Head towards the Little Dishman Lead climbing area, and its on your left on the trail. You can't miss it.

content.description: Fairly crux start, but pretty solid line all the way to the top out. Start on the left side of the rock and move your way right until you reach the big side pull jugs and start heading up.
content.location: Walking to the Little Dishman lead routes saw the gem of a line on my left going towards the Wall. Decided to clean and send it, ended up being a super solid and fun line.

content.description:
From David Donally:

Your bet? $1 Bob! Dont get sucked in, and the price is right.
content.protection: 5 bolts to lower-off stainless carabiners. Also, easily TR if you desire.

content.description: This route can be climbed a couple different ways depending on how hard you want to make it. Stay just right of the bolts for a 5.7ish experience up the arete, or keep a little left of the bolts for a couple grades higher.
content.protection: Four bolts to stainless carabiner lower-offs. First bolt is a little high off the ground, but it is an easy climb up to it.

content.description: Crux is getting the nuts to send the dyno with the sorta sketch landing, make sure you have a couple pads and a couple spotters.
content.protection: At least two pads if you wanna be able to fall
content.location: First route on the left of the the wall .

content.description: Crux is probably the start, use the small ledges marked X in the photo, stay super squished and pull up into a decent sloper. the top that main left side, try not cross over from the left side of climb for holds.
crux is near the top out when you have to take advantage of a counter pressure crack. No issue if your a decent climber. But seen plently oh new climbs take a spill from that point on.
content.location: Left of the main wall of Little Dish, right as you reach the clearing.

content.description: Go up the arete sitting from the start hold - check out the top out before hand to find the ankle-saving jug.
content.location: Far left of Little Dishman crag (if looking at the bolted routes)

content.description:
From David Donally:

Fight to clip the first theif-proof bolt then stand up tall to show off your courage and clip again. Multiple combinations lead to the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts to lower-off stainless carabiners. Also can be TR easily but watch for rope drag.

content.description: Slightly overhung with jugs all the way to the top. Can use the crack and go left, or use the shelf holds and go right at midway.
content.location: This route is located at Tiny Dishman. Just walk up the gully another 100 feet or so after Little Dishman. This is the first route on the left.

content.description: Fun movements on good rock. The route starts on a small sloping vertical crack on the right edge of the bouldering wall. It moves along to a match on a sloper and then out to a long left side pull. A pleasant knee bar unlocks a solid right hand crimp above your head allowing for a left hand bump to another great side pull, a satisfying right crossover undercling and a finish up to the left with a solid ledge to hang on and celebrate. Multiple ways to do this one. Shout out and thank you to Greg and Jared for cleaning up this area!
content.protection: Pad if you want. Most of it is pretty low to the ground.
content.location: Located on the left hand side of the trail on the wayÂ to the little Dishman climbing wall. The route starts on the right hand side of a bouldering wall and moves left and upward

content.description: Super easy, dont really need to use hands, top outs a bit high with a sketch landing tho.
content.location: Head to tiny dishman main wall area and this climb is on the back left from when you walk from the parking lot.

content.description:
From David Donally:

Like a Sunday morning at the mall: An enthusiastic hang-over start leads to a sobering section in the middle. There is room for nausea on the ledges above. Happy Hunting!
content.protection: 5 bolts to lower-off stainless carabiners. Finish anchors shared with "The Price is Right." Watch out for swinging if you TR.

content.description: Sit start to fun moves up the diagonal crack to a delicious top out.
content.location: Obvious boulder face to the left of 30 feet of fury

content.description: Stand into the steepness and clip the first. Make a froggy stance on the marshmellow blob to clip the second. Find your way to the anchors. Try the dyno clip follwed by a short girlish scream.
content.location: This route is located at Tiny Dishman. Just walk up the gully another 100 feet or so after Little Dishman. This is the third route on the left.
